meanings.definition: The quality of being extremely beautiful or delicate.
meanings.sent1: The exquisitenesses of the flower garden took my breath away.
meanings.sent2: She admired the exquisitenesses of the intricate lacework.
meanings.sent3: The exquisitenesses of the cake decoration made it almost too beautiful to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her dance was like a display of exquisitenesses, each movement a delicate masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The exquisitenesses of the sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and gold.

meanings.definition: The state of being finely made or crafted.
meanings.sent1: The exquisitenesses of the handmade jewelry were evident in every detail.
meanings.sent2: The exquisitenesses of the wooden carving impressed all who saw it.
meanings.sent3: He took pride in the exquisitenesses of his model ship collection.
meanings.sent4: The exquisitenesses of the ancient tapestry told a story through its intricate design.
meanings.sent5: The exquisitenesses of the porcelain vase made it a prized possession.

meanings.definition: The act of showing great attention to detail or precision.
meanings.sent1: Her exquisitenesses in arranging the flowers made the room look stunning.
meanings.sent2: The tailor's exquisitenesses in stitching the dress were evident in the flawless seams.
meanings.sent3: The chef's exquisitenesses in plating the dish made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The artist's exquisitenesses in brush strokes created a masterpiece on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The architect's exquisitenesses in designing the building made it stand out in the cityscape.
